questions.question: Which comparison is true?
Haruko did 9 sit-ups in P.E. class. The number of sit-ups Tom did can be represented by the expression 2 × 9. Which statement is true?
options: Tom did 2 times as many sit-ups as Haruko.
Haruko did 2 times as many sit-ups as Tom.
Tom did 2 more sit-ups than Haruko.
Haruko did 2 more sit-ups than Tom.
questions.correct_answer: Tom did 2 times as many sit-ups as Haruko.

questions.question: A student measured the lengths of two worms. Worm S was 1/2 foot long. Worm T was 2/2 foot long. Which statement is true?
options: The length of Worm S is greater than the length of Worm T.
The length of Worm T is greater than the length of Worm S.
The length of Worm S is equal to the length of Worm T.
There is not enough information to compare the lengths of the worms.
questions.correct_answer: The length of Worm T is greater than the length of Worm S.

questions.question: Trey is describing his labor and income. Which statement could be a description of both labor and income for Trey?
options: Trey does volunteer work at a hospital.
Trey pays a company to repair his roof.
Trey takes $25 out of his bank account and spends the money at a store.
Trey takes dogs for a walk after school and earns $25.
questions.correct_answer: Trey takes dogs for a walk after school and earns $25.

questions.question: The rectangular floor of Ms. Ragan’s closet is completely covered with carpet squares. Each carpet square covers 1 square foot of the floor. There are 4 rows, and each row has 16 carpet squares. What is the area of the floor of this closet in square feet?
Gia lists some different methods she thinks she can use to solve the multiplication problem 7 × 11 = ? Which answer choice is NOT a correct method for Gia to use?
options: Using a number line from 0 to 80.
Using repeated addition.

questions.question: A group of figures is shown. Which word best describes all the figures in the group?
options: Rectangle
Rhombus
Trapezoid
Parallelogram

questions.question: The table shows the numbers of tomato plants and spinach plants in five different gardens. Based on the relationship shown in the table, which statement is true?
options: There are 9 more spinach plants than tomato plants in each garden.
There are 9 fewer spinach plants than tomato plants in each garden.
There are 8 more spinach plants than tomato plants in each garden.
There are 8 fewer spinach plants than tomato plants in each garden.
questions.correct_answer: There are 9 more spinach plants than tomato plants in each garden.

questions.question: The picture shows 8 seats in a movie theater. Children are sitting in a fraction of the seats. Which expression is equivalent to the fraction of the seats that have children sitting in them?
Which number sentence can be used to find the number that goes in the box: 12 ÷ 2 = □?
Which list shows the numbers in order from greatest to least value?
Gerardo bought 3 packages of mint gum and 2 packages of bubble gum. Each package had 8 pieces of gum. How many pieces of gum did Gerardo buy?
The expanded form of a number is shown: 90,000 + 200 + 40 + 1. What is the standard form of this number?
Serafina put a total of 42 cupcakes into packages. She put 6 cupcakes into each package. What is the total number of packages Serafina used for these cupcakes?
Which number is odd?

Freddie had $256 in his bank account. On Monday he put $50 more into his account. On Tuesday he took out $87 to buy a bicycle. Which equation can be used to find the amount of money Freddie had in his bank account after he took out money on Tuesday?
Brandon drew two congruent squares. He divided one square into 2 congruent triangular parts and the other into 2 congruent rectangular parts. Which statement is true?
options: Each triangular part and each rectangular part represents 1/2 the area of one square.
Each triangular part has an area that is greater than the area of each rectangular part.
Each triangular part and each rectangular part represents 1/4 the area of one square.
Each rectangular part has an area that is greater than the area of each triangular part.
questions.correct_answer: Each triangular part and each rectangular part represents 1/2 the area of one square.

questions.question: Felix spent 19 minutes swimming, 21 minutes riding his bike, and 30 minutes running in a race. What was the total amount of time Felix spent swimming, riding his bike, and running in this race?
options: 1 hour 20 minutes
40 minutes
1 hour 10 minutes
1 hour

questions.question: There are 8 oranges in each bag for sale at a store. Which table shows the relationship between the number of bags and the number of oranges in the bags?
options: 2 bags: 8 oranges; 3 bags: 16 oranges; 4 bags: 24 oranges; 5 bags: 32 oranges
2 bags: 16 oranges; 3 bags: 24 oranges; 4 bags: 32 oranges; 5 bags: 40 oranges
2 bags: 10 oranges; 3 bags: 11 oranges; 4 bags: 12 oranges; 5 bags: 13 oranges
2 bags: 16 oranges; 3 bags: 32 oranges; 4 bags: 64 oranges; 5 bags: 128 oranges
questions.correct_answer: 2 bags: 16 oranges; 3 bags: 24 oranges; 4 bags: 32 oranges; 5 bags: 40 oranges

questions.question: Stacy used 21 feet of ribbon to make bows. She used 3 feet of ribbon for each bow. Which equation can be used to find the number of bows Stacy made with this ribbon?
Which comparison and explanation are true?
options: 5/6 < 5/8, because eighths are larger than sixths
5/6 < 5/8, because sixths are larger than eighths
5/6 > 5/8, because eighths are larger than sixths
5/6 > 5/8, because sixths are larger than eighths
questions.correct_answer: 5/6 > 5/8, because sixths are larger than eighths

questions.question: Gina’s journal has a square cover with a side length of 24 cm. What is the perimeter of the cover of Gina’s journal in centimeters?
Roger has two boxes of nails. One box has 438 nails, and the other box has 375 nails. How many nails does Roger have in these two boxes?
A group of 27 students played a game with hoops. An equal number of the students shared each hoop. How many students shared each hoop?
Point P on the number line represents two equivalent fractions. Which two equivalent fractions can point P represent?
There are 6 photographs on each page of an album. How many photographs are on 9 pages of the album?
The table shows the amount of money four people gave a cashier and the change they received. Based on the relationship shown, which statement is true?
options: A drink costs 52 cents, because the amount given minus 52 equals the change.
A drink costs 52 cents, because the amount given plus 52 equals the change.
A drink costs 48 cents, because the amount given minus 48 equals the change.
A drink costs 48 cents, because the amount given plus 48 equals the change.
questions.correct_answer: A drink costs 52 cents, because the amount given minus 52 equals the change.

questions.question: Ms. Patterson works for a company. Which factor would most likely affect the amount of money Ms. Patterson gets paid by the company?
options: The amount of money Ms. Patterson has to pay in bills
The size of Ms. Patterson’s family
The amount of money Ms. Patterson saves every month
The work experience Ms. Patterson has
questions.correct_answer: The work experience Ms. Patterson has

questions.question: Samantha’s ice chest weighed 83 pounds. Gordon’s weighed 28 pounds, and Diego’s weighed 37 pounds. What was the difference in pounds between the weight of Samantha’s ice chest and the combined weight of Gordon’s and Diego’s ice chests?
The figures shown can be sorted into groups. Which list shows a correct way to group these figures?
options: 1 triangle, 3 quadrilaterals, and 1 pentagon
1 triangle and 4 quadrilaterals
1 triangle, 3 quadrilaterals, and 1 hexagon
1 triangle, 2 quadrilaterals, and 2 pentagons
